meanings.definition: A violent windstorm, especially one with rain, hail, or snow.
meanings.sent1: The tempests outside rattled the windows and shook the house.
meanings.sent2: The sailors braved the tempests at sea, fighting against the raging winds and crashing waves.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a disaster when unexpected tempests ruined the food and decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her anger brewed like a tempest, ready to unleash its fury at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The tempests roared through the valley, leaving a trail of destruction in their wake.

meanings.sent2: The political debate turned into a tempests of conflicting opinions and heated arguments.
meanings.sent3: The tempests of laughter erupted from the classroom, causing a joyful chaos.
meanings.sent4: The news of the scandal created a tempests of gossip throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: His arrival at the party caused a tempests of excitement among the guests.
